intro: Sideritis carbonellii, commonly known as Carbonell's ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Sideritis carbonellii is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
